title: JG: "Top, can you please play AP?"   TOP: "Ok, np. I'm going Rumble"  JG: "Alright man, thanks :D"
body:
_Our Rumble gets rekt hard by Pantheon_

JG: Report our Rumble feeding.

-----

Can't believe I'm actually witnessing the most ironic thing I've ever seen. 

So if anyone still doesn't get what the title means, our team in Champ Select was fully AD, and tbh, I don't really have a problem with it (_I was Support Janna btw_). And then our Rengar jungle requests our top laner to switch to an AP champion. See, our top laner was Jax at first, til he switched to Rumble in the end. 

In late game, our Rumble did horribly & gave the enemy top laner a head start. After that, our Rengar jungle decides to constantly whine & rant on our Rumble for his inexperience & feeding.  I mean for instance, it was HE who requests our top laner to change his intended pick, and second, if our jungler wants an AP champion so much, he should changed it HIMSELF.

------

So to players who has the same attitude as this Rengar here, you deserved a bitch-slap.

replies.body:
Rumble is actually a good Pantheon counter and Pantheon is a good Jax counter lol. I'm sure he is more experienced on Jax but I wouldn't assume it would have gone better with Jax top.

Also Jax does plenty of magic dmg so I don't know why he needed to switch to AP. Actually I kinda like Jax on all AD comps because it baits them into going all armor and Jax is deceptively effective at that point.
THANK YOU. Jax is a unique blend of physical and magic damage, and when I try to explain that to my teammates, no ever seems to care.

it really depends on jungle interaction or lack of interaction. If rumble is focused by the enemy jungler and gets no help warding, he is easily repeat ganked and killed multiple times before lvl 6 or chunked low and forced to miss out on tons of farm and xp. Rumble doesn't have the option of freezing on panth either because he needs to use flamespitter to farm and that auto-pushes the wave. Panth sits back until it is on cd, then farms. When panth is sitting back, he's slinging spears to chunk rumble since rumble shield is a joke of an ability. When rumble is half hp, panth goes in, stun, e, autos, q to finish kill. 1v1 i'm sure rumble can be ok, but he's not going to crush the matchup either unless he's a way better rumble than the other guy is at panth. 2v2, rumble wins hands down especially after lvl 6. But if it's a 1v1 or 1v2 with enemy jungle camping rumble hard early, rumble is screwed.

The Rengar deserves a report but the rumble deserves the loss. If he's never played Rumble before then he shouldn't be playing Rumble just because his team asked him to. In solo queue you gotta be confident in yourself. An appropriate comment would be "Sorry, but I feel more confident on Jax" or something. The Rengar might have said "Okay, then I'll go AP then." The Rengar probably figured that since the top agreed, that he was decent as Rumble. 

But yeah. That Rengar seems toxic af. Pls ban, Rito.

{{champion:107}} WE NEED AN AP TOP
{{champion:24}} {{item:3146}} {{item:3089}} {{item:3285}} {{item:3100}} {{item:3135}} {{item:3020}}  I gotchu fam

Soliciting Reports is filed under Harassment, and therefore Reportable in itself.

Someone having a bad game isn't reportable though.

So the Rengar is far more likely to get into trouble with reports than Rumble is.

he isnt saying that rengar should get in trouble instead of rumble, what he's saying is that, rumble who wanted to play jax, switched his champion to an ap because the jungler (who could just have easily gone ap) asked him to. And then the jgler got mad because the toplaner didnt know how to play the champ he didnt want to play.
I just want that Rengar to know that I think he is an ass.

It doesn't matter if a team is full AP or full AD any more. Maybe it did back when defense items worked, but it's easy enough for the entire team to build penetration--- and in the case of a full AD team the most effective tactic is often doing that even without an enemy tank.

All AD, just ignore team fights (don't force them and peel from them) and push objectives. Split push and put the enemy on tilt who wants to build armor and fight, while you ignore them and get turrets.

People just can't think past A versus B in their strategy, and act like malfunctioning robots when you try to explain macro play.

Honestly fuck that strategy.

Theres literally 0 ways to win against 5 split pushers thats ive ever found.

Full AD comps will work, but they have to snowball hard enough that the enemy team can't stack defenses fast enough. I've played Nautilus top into full AD teams and become an unkillable disruption bastard as my team cleans up every fight.

That being said, if they DO snowball... That same Nautilus gets instantly deleted with 400 armor and 5k HP.

EDIT: typos

Haha, we were getting steamrolled by a full ad team, I was vi support, lag caused me to afk for 5 minutes to fix my problems, I came back, built pure armor, they couldn't touch me at all, and i was the only one with any tank items, just got in their face over and over and over and over.
Why switch from Jax? Just build AP on him.

when you see a matchup like that where one toplaner can easily get poked out by the other and has no innate sustain or ability to build tanky enough to ignore the other laner's damage, it is the jungler's job to help that lane early. I mean gank multiple times, apply pressure - don't back off just because you are spotted if the enemy is pushed to your laner's tower he's got a long way to run and you can chunk him low and force him to back. Give wards to your toplaner so he/she can play agro when the opportunities are given. Rumble has his ult? Gank top, land a root with empowered e and get rumble a kill on panth. Then make sure he can safely push the wave in and either get top tower or back and buy if that's what he/she wants to do. Worried about ending up 2v2? Dude you have a rumble - he's way stronger 2v2 than panth - especially when rumble has access to ult.
My response when someone asks me to change to an ap champ, from zed mid, is "We're in bronze, nobody is going to build armor anyways." I've never had anybody argue that logic with me.

mfw "he should [play it] himself" is a horrible excuse, especially given no context to pick order, to champ draft.
at least this is in the correct board.

It was Normal Blind (_we don't have Normal Draft in Garena server_). We all had our champions ready, til Rengar asked our top laner to change. 

Sure, Normals still shouldn't be taken lightly since everyone needs to at least try & win, but to come to a point where the jungler trash-talked a player of whom HE asked to change, that's a different story.

On top of, when you ask someone to change from an intended champ (likely something they have experience on), to another (that they likely don't have as much experience), then you don't help get them ahead, you are basically an asshole.

If you have an all AD team, and ONE ap champ, then why aren't you trying to help that person who changed because YOU asked? You are hurting your team, then you decide to flame. Seriously whoever this jungler was, is an a-hole, and a moron (just being honest).
If you play a certain way, unless ABSOLUTELY NECESSARY don't force yourself to play a certain way or champion unless you can do it. Learned that the hard way.
I woulda instalocked {{champion:38}}  top.

how it usually goes is top and jungle pick ad.  mid then picks ad and never says anything forcing ad team comp.
Or even better is how often ill be last pick mid  and our team comp needs heavy cc, front line tank, full ap carry, wave clear, and be safe cause some how they picked an ad comp with no cc, front line ( remotely tanky), with even a little wave clear. (tryn, khaz, jinx, soraka team comp)
Isn't that always the way it goes... This is why I always counter it with "hey, you wanted them/me to play X"
What do you think this is, huh? Kidz Bop 2064? This is League of Legends. No one works together here.
I was hoping this was gonna be "look at these guys communicating and working together!" kind of thread...

Ever since s6 hit live almost a year ago, i've seen full AD teams doing just fine and in the end outscaling the others that included ap champs in them. Besides, with all the magic damage abilities that even AD champs have, along with magic damage keystones like thunderlord's and the massive penetration available, i'd say full AD teams have decreased disadvantages in comparison to previous seasons, thus i'd never swap my pick.

This is why I dont listen to other players in my chat. I can carry even with full ad teams. The one time I listened to my team and went ap Kayle, we lose because I was not fed enough to help the other lanes that fed their ass off (they all had 6 deaths at the 20 minute mark while i had 2).

Our Top Laner: Hey jungler,  we're all AD, can you play AP?
Me: NO PROBLEM DUDE! _**plays AP Xin Zhao**_

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oVWMAgErKOA
I honder how dafuq can Rumble lose to pantheon... just shield his lance And Q him lol.

A Garen with Black Cleaver can solve the problem of enemies stacking armor.
About 50% armor just shredded off from a few spins.
His ultimate does magic/true damage, rendering any armor at all useless.
On top of that, ADC itemization for armor penetration is really strong.
http://i3.kym-cdn.com/entries/icons/original/000/007/508/watch-out-we-got-a-badass-over-here-meme.png
